CatDescriptText: Mrs. Connie Mitchell, housewife, 7108 Tilden Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 25, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think those receiving Mother's Assistance should be required to report to the proper authorities just how all of the grant is spent, or should the present latitude in spending it be permitted to continue?" answer reads: "They should be required to itemize it so that the taxpayers will know just how their money is being spent."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Connie Mitchell wearing light colored hat with dark stripe and netting, holding handbag and paper bag, standing in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
